title: Update regarding Velocity Motors
story_body:
In a routine update, Velocity Motors (VELO) has announced several personnel changes within its leadership team. Effective immediately, long-time employee and native of nearby Livonia, Michigan, Karen Thompson, will be taking on the role of Director of Community Outreach. Thompson, who has been with the company for over a decade, will be responsible for strengthening ties between VELO and local organizations in the Detroit metropolitan area.

In related news, VELO has also launched a new marketing campaign focused on highlighting the company's commitment to the local community. The campaign, titled "Built in Detroit, Built for You," aims to showcase VELO's contributions to the regional economy and its dedication to providing jobs for area residents. The company currently employs over 2,500 people in the Detroit area, with a significant portion of those employees residing in the city of Dearborn.

On the environmental, social, and governance (ESG) front, VELO has announced plans to partner with the City of Detroit to implement a new electric vehicle charging station pilot program. The program, which is set to launch later this year, will provide VELO employees and local residents with access to convenient and affordable EV charging options. This initiative is part of the company's broader efforts to reduce its carbon footprint and promote sustainability in the region.

In a statement, a VELO spokesperson noted that the company is committed to being a responsible corporate citizen and is dedicated to working with local stakeholders to drive positive change in the community. With its headquarters located in the heart of Detroit, VELO is well-positioned to continue making a meaningful impact in the region for years to come.
